questionTitle: People who think only of themselves without concern for others are ..................
If the weather ........... fine, I shall go out.
A person who is not distinguished in any way is .............. .
If he had known her new address, he ......... to see her.
A person who reads and thinks a lot is .............. .
When you come to the crossroads, you will see the ...... showing the way to Trafalgar square.
A person who is easily annoyed or made angry is ...............
Thomson's mother is still looking for him. Hasn't he ....................... yet?
People ................... apply themselves seriously to their work are hardworking.
Peter is worried .................. his final exam in English.
I don't know whether to take that English course or not. If I ........ you, I'd take it.
The teacher told her pupils ........................ down.
It's no use ............ a language if you don't try to speak it.
A person who has a different opinion from other people is ..................
She was offered the job ........... her qualifications were poor.
A person who has good sense and judgement is .................
We are sure to pass the exam. We feel sure ........... it.
We can describe someone who is fond ................ sport is sporty.
